title: news.com.au — Australia’s #1 news site
text: A major music festival taking place in Sydney on Saturday will follow strict regulations, despite the fact they've already been repealed. The Saturday Telegraph reports the organisers of ‘Listen Out’ will adhere to the old guidelines, which have been scrapped as part of changes to lock out laws. NSW Premier Gladys Berejiklian had fought to keep the festival rules in place but Labor and the Greens teamed up with the Shooters, Fishers and Farmers to weaken them. Premier Berejiklian is considering her options to have the regulations reinstated.
